site.strathcona

Class STRCustomerNormalizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • site.CustomerLoadNormalizer
      • site.HorizonNormalizer
        • site.strathcona.STRCustomerNormalizer

  • public final class STRCustomerNormalizer
extends HorizonNormalizer
    Normalizes the customer's data before loading into the local library's ILS. The local library may require certain modifications to a customer account such as minimum PIN width, or application of a computed bStat value.
    Author:
    Andrew Nisbet

      • normalize

        public ResponseTypes normalize(Customer c,
                      java.lang.StringBuilder responseStringBuilder)
        Description copied from class: CustomerLoadNormalizer
        Normalizes the customer data to local load restrictions like minimum PIN width.
        Overrides:
        normalize in class HorizonNormalizer
        Parameters:
        c - customer object must not be null.
        responseStringBuilder - the response from the normalization process.
        Returns:
        String message of what was changed that the customer should know about. In the above example they would be notified that St. Albert has their last 4 digits of their EPL Pin saved.

      • finalize

        public void finalize(Customer unformattedCustomer,
            FormattedCustomer formattedCustomer,
            Response response)
        Description copied from class: CustomerLoadNormalizer
        This method applies all the final touches to the customer's account pre- loading to the ILS. This is where default values are applied, bStats are computed. It is the last stop before loading.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class HorizonNormalizer
        Parameters:
        unformattedCustomer - the value of unformattedCustomer
        formattedCustomer - the value of formattedCustomer
        response - the value of response
